description: This toolkit is a step-by-step guide to every stage of the project cycle for projects targeted at ending violence against women â€“ from basic concepts such as gender, human rights and project design through to needs assessments, workplans, data collection, media outreach, stakeholder relationships and monitoring and evaluation techniques. It incorporates a number of group activities, tips, templates and online resources, as well as a list of potential funding sources. It was developed to provide organisations with a resource that supports them on some of the more technical aspects of project planning, design, implementation and evaluation that are required by donors.
keywords: development-programming, ending-violence-against-women, pacific-women, social-norms, toolkit, violence
name: EVAW toolkit first of its kind in the Pacific
